events.name: Bachav Workshop -  Secure Coding Series - Java
events.description:
RSVP will start on 20th June. We are pleased to inform you the first part in the secure coding bachav workshop series by Pieter Danhieux   Please note, this event is a FREE hands-on workshop, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive email from bachav champion by 16th July 2016. *** We are looking for more speakers to contribute to this series. Please get in touch if you are interested.   Selection Criteria: Selection (15-20 persons only) will be based on the following two criteria: 1. Contribution to the community. Speakers, humla, bachav champions, core team, volunteers  and venue hosts will get priority to the workshop.  2. Passion towards Information security + the attendance in previous meet ups.  If you are new to the community, selection will be based on the answers to the survey questions asked during the registration process. Please answer these questions carefully.  Workshop Agenda: Do you think you can code securely? During this 2 hour workshops, the Secure Code Warrior team is going to brief you about the most common web app weaknesses before letting you go nuts on the Secure Code Warrior platform. Whether you are a junior developer in JAVA or C#, application security professional, Ruby geek, senior software engineer or penetration tester ... this platform will challenge your skills and provide you with an overview of your strengths and weaknesses in secure coding.  Who should attend this event ?  Developers, developers, developers Security people who want to know about secure coding  Requirements for labs: - Laptop that can connect to WiFi and has a modern browser with javascript enabled - Understanding of either JAVA J2EE/JSP, JAVA Spring, Ruby on Rails, C# .NET or Python. 


Null Bachav Champion: Pieter Danhieux is the Founder and CEO of Secure Code Warrior, an innovative web-based corporate education and assessment platform where software developers use hands-on learning to build secure-coding skills.  Pieter is also a Principal instructor for the SANS Institute teaching military, government and private organisations offensive techniques on how to target and assess organisations, systems and individuals for security weaknesses. He also serves as an advisory board member of NVISO, a cyber security consulting company in Europe. Before starting his own company, Pieter work at Ernst & Young and BAE Systems. He started his information security career early in life and obtained the Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification as one of the youngest persons ever in Belgium. On his way, he collected a whole range of cyber security certificates (CISA, GCFA, GCIH, GPEN, GWAP) and is currently one of the select few people worldwide to hold the top certification GIAC Security Expert (GSE).
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: ProductTank: Communication
events.description:
THEME: PRODUCT COMMUNICATION Have you heard about a "bar test" for startup ideas? It goes like this: if you can't explain a startup idea to someone who's getting drunk at a bar on a Friday night, forget about it. :) Solid communication is an integral part of strong product management practice. Whether we're talking about startups of established products, success of your work as a product manager hinges on the ability to craft a good story. Join us on July 20 and learn how you could do that better! • Using storytelling patterns to build a compelling product narrative • Communication within the product development team  


SPEAKERS AND TALKS #1 Yi Chiao Cheng, Lead Experience Innovation Consultant; IBM—The Power of Stories in Product Communication Yi Chiao, or Yitch, as he's known in the Singaporean tech community, is an interactive experience consultant. He's currently helping companies in legacy healthcare and telecom sectors to transform their digital strategy and align it with the expectations of young consumers. In his work, Yitch frequently experiments with media design & interactive arts, and even holds a patent pending in those fields. He's currently diving into VR/ AR as a next possible project. 


#2 Jason Fraser, Director of the Innovation Practice; Pivotal Labs—Communication within the product team [Exact title pending]   NOTE: This is a lightning talk! Jason is a world class product leader who's currently overseeing the innovation practice at Pivotal Labs. He stopped by Singapore to set up the local office of Pivotal Labs, and agreed to give a quick talk at ProductTank. This is going to be fun! :) 


AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:05 - 19:35 - First speaker: talk and Q&A (20 min + 10 min) 19:35 - 19:50 - Break! [Also, letting late attendees into the room.] 19:50 - 20:05 - Second speaker: talk and Q&A ( 5 min + 10 min) 20:05 - 21:00 - Networking. 21:00 - Event ends. 


Notes: • Exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm. • Registration closes at 00:00 on Tuesday, July 19. • Remember to bring your ID for a smooth check-in with the building security. :) • IMPORTANT: Please, try to be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break (7:35pm). This is due to building security's quirks, and the event host doesn't have control over it.

events.name: Real world uses of Big Data and Business Intelligence
events.description: In collaboration with BiTS, CodingGirls will be hosting a workshop on how big data influences business decisions. Experts from BiTS will present real-life examples of big data and business intelligence and how data-driven strategies can help business like Singapore small and medium enterprises stay competitive.

events.name: Testing + Running a 16 Terabyte JVM
events.description:
Talk 1: Test like a Pro! (Han Lim and Alan Menant) Testing is often neglected by developers. We are always trying to find a pretext not to test our apps - “it is too difficult”, “there is nothing to test”, “no time for that”, “can’t test with external dependencies” etc... . We will show you how to introduce testing to different aspects of your code so that you can instill confidence in yourself and others on the correctness of your programs. This session will be an introduction about applying TDD in your unit tests, writing good integration tests, incorporating front-end JS test and good / bad testing practices. After the presentation you’ll have no excuse for not testing your code like a pro. 



Talk 2: Operating a 16TB JVM... And Living to Tell the Tale (Nida Bouzid and Antoine Chambille) Is there a limit to the size of the heap the Java Virtual Machine can handle? Java blogs often report 100GB as the maximum amount of memory the JVM will manage effortlessly. Yet at Quartet FS we develop "ActivePivot", an In-Memory analytical platform written in pure Java and that is commonly deployed on a terabyte of memory. But the real story began when one of our customers challenged us to run a large credit risk use case on 16TB of memory. We managed to do it, but only when all the layers of the solution came together: data structures and thread management in the Java code, garbage collection in the JVM, memory management in the OS. In this presentation we will share all the steps to achieve this.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: EML: Artistry [After Dark]
events.description:
Ready to enjoy new, original, live electronic music from six hot new electronic music artists, curated by the NUS Electronic Music Lab (based at NUS Centre For The Arts) over good food and drinks in a great venue Artistry Cafe? Join us at AFTER DARK and listen to mixed genres that include House, Drum & Bass, Experimental, Ambient, Electro Pop, EDM, Trance, Trip Hop. Meet the new artists and find out how you can be a part of the growing Singapore original electronic music scene.

ARTISTS:
Bryan Tan
ROYLE
Axiam Music

Rafael Leafar featuring Three Hunters
